page.title: 10Hatton Craft Centre
page.content: This is shown on some maps as Hatton Farm. Until three years ago this was a working farm, keeping mainly animals. It is now a Craft Centre, attracting five thousand visitors per year. The buildings have been divided into smaller units which have been let to various craftspeople and businesses. At the moment there are twenty five businesses here including glass engraving, chairmaking, wood turning, printing, paperweights, needlecraft, pottery, a candlemaker, woolcraft, picture framing, a saddle maker and leather goods, vintage cars, pen and ink drawing, a florists and a tea shop for refreshments. Admission is free but visitors can purchase things from the various businesses.
